image.altText: A medium sized green sea turtle lies in sand with seaweed around it.

props.synopsis: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

title.children: Claude the turtle's survival provides glimmer of hope amid algal bloom

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: An expert in artificial intelligence says a fake image depicting missing four-year-old Gus being abducted in South Australia's outback highlights the dangerous link between AI and the spread of misinformation.

title.children: Expert says AI-generated image of missing boy Gus case raises serious concerns

image.altText: An elderly man in a navy blue jumper standing with his arms crossed in front of a building

props.synopsis: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

title.children: Patients travel hours from SA city to see a GP as shortage persists

image.altText: A close up of a surfboard showing clear bite marks.

props.synopsis: A man who witnessed the "extraordinary" moment a surfer was bitten by a shark chasing a seal offshore Kangaroo Island has spoken to the ABC after his footage circulated online.

title.children: 'Always go surfing with a doctor': Shark attack witness shares 'extraordinary' moment

image.altText: THUMB: Map project energyconnect

props.synopsis: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

title.children: 'Extension cord to nowhere' looms large as Australiaâ€™s energy transition evolves

image.altText: A man stares into the lens

props.synopsis: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.Â

title.children: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: An audit has revealed an Adelaide aged care facility was inappropriately using restraints on patients, raising the question of whether the state government has learned from the Oakden aged care scandal in 2017.

title.children: Has the SA government learned from the Oakden aged care scandal?

image.altText: Australian agribusiness Elders

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

title.children: ACCC approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta

image.altText: An aerial view of Pumicestone Passage showing the new and old channels between the passage and the ocean.

props.synopsis: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

title.children: Scramble to protect island bee colony from parasitic killer

image.altText: A plane on the runway with people standing around

props.synopsis: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.Â

title.children: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport

image.altText: Shaun de Bruyn stands in a grassed area wearing a white shirt and navy suit

props.synopsis: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

title.children: Tourism operators facing 'dire straits' without more algal bloom relief

image.altText: A headshot of Taylor Swift with jewels and feathers surrounding her head

props.synopsis: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

title.children: Taylor Swift shines in Australian-designed dress in lead single

image.altText: Bella Kolinac stands with her bike helmet on on an outback road.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship â€” Women in Kona, Hawaii. Â

title.children: Outback athlete shares journey to ironman world championship

image.altText: CCTV video of man about to attack blonde woman on street.

props.synopsis: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.Â

title.children: In the world's 'phone theft capital', one Aussie decides to fight back

image.altText: close up of russian soldiers shouting the national anthem

props.synopsis: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

title.children: Russia's 180,000 convict soldiers are causing concern for Putin

image.altText: Four khaki military trucks with red stars carry large missiles.

props.synopsis: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

title.children: Is the US military build-up on these islands inviting China's missiles?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese (4)

props.synopsis: The prime minister has congratulated the US president for helping clinch a peace deal with Israel and Hamas to bring the conflict in Gaza to an end.

title.children: PM congratulates Donald Trump for clinching Gaza peace deal â€” as it happened

image.altText: A person holds up a phone showing the Google search web page.

props.synopsis: The launch of 'AI Mode' ushers in a future where news sites are kept alive to train AI chatbots for a US tech company.

title.children: A tiny new button in your search bar could kill the open web

image.altText: Text messages are collaged over the protest on the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal internal discussions within the NSW government did not align with the external NSW Police messaging that the march could have been "catastrophic".

title.children: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Harbour Bridge Gaza march unfolded

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The former military lawyer was sentenced to five years and eight months in jail after sharing classified material with journalists in a case that has raised debate about whistleblower laws.Â

title.children: David McBride loses last-ditch effort to overturn conviction

image.altText: Kate Middleton speaking and gesturing with her hands, wearing a green suit.

props.synopsis: In a joint essay with a Harvard Medical School professor, Princess Kate says the young generation may be the most digitally connected but is "simultaneously being more isolated".

title.children: Princess of Wales warns screen time feeds 'epidemic of disconnection'

image.altText: Footballer Sam Kerr waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr is back in the Matildas squad for the first time since late 2023, ahead of friendlies against Wales and England.Â

title.children: Kerr's return confirmed, Matildas name squad for England and Wales matches

image.altText: Charlie Curnow pumps his right fist during Carlton's AFL win over Essendon.

props.synopsis: Day five of the AFL trade period is off with a bang as Carlton receives a first official bid for Charlie Curnow, as the fallout continues from St Kilda's backflip on Leek Aleer. Follow live.Â

image.altText: boy looking away from the cameara with ABC hat on

props.synopsis: Hayden Eastbury lives with fragile X syndrome. He dreams of working for the ABC one day and has made it his mission to visit them all.

image.altText: Two leaders at a podium

props.synopsis: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.Â

title.children: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty

image.altText: A neon Synergy sign inside the company's Perth office.

props.synopsis: More than 170,000 customers have been overcharged a total of $40 million by WA's state-owned energy retailer Synergy since 2009, as its chief executive apologises.

title.children: Synergy apologises after overcharging customers $40 million in power bills

image.altText: A collapsed power pole leaning across a road.

props.synopsis: Wind gusts of more than 100kph are recorded in multiple towns as a "vigorous cold front" sweeps across Tasmania.

title.children: Hospital damaged, power outages for thousands as severe winds smash Tasmania

image.altText: A young person with serious but confident expression stands in green parklands in black beanie, t-shirt with graphics.

title.children: Judge dismisses Drake's lawsuit over Kendrick Lamar diss track

image.altText: police on motorcycles drive toward a black police cordon

props.synopsis: Three people are detained after an "improvised device" is found at the home of one of the suspects in an investigation into terrorist activities.

title.children: Planned terror attack on Belgium's prime minister foiled by police

image.altText: a profile of Ferras

props.synopsis: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.Â

title.children: First Guardian financial adviser says he relied on super trustees

image.altText: A middle-aged black woman stands behind a podium in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.Â

title.children: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud

image.altText: Capt Dave Holt, pictured with his son, William in a cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

title.children: International pilots grounded at 65: What it means for travellers
